doc.ContractDescription: PROBING THE MAGNETIC FIELD STRUCTURE ALONG THE EDGE OF THE FERMI BUBBLES FERMI-LAT DATA REVEALED A PAIR OF GIGANTIC GAMMA-RAY EMITTING BUBBLES CALLED THE FERMI BUBBLES TOWARDS THE INNER GALAXY. THE ORIGIN OF THE STRUCTURE IS STILL HIGHLY DEBATED AND THE IMPACT TO THE ISM IS STILL UNCLEAR. THE BUBBLES MIGHT BE MAGNETIZED, QUASI-FREELY EXPANDING RARIFIED CAVITIES WITH HIGHLY TANGLED FIELD LINES. KNOWLEDGE OF THE PHYSICAL CONDITIONS ON THE EXPANDING SURFACE OF THE BUBBLES INTO THE GALACTIC HALO (POSSIBLY A SHOCK FRONT), IN PARTICULAR THE MAGNETIC FIELD STRENGTH AND CONFIGURATION, IS CRUCIAL TO EXPLORE THE EFFECTS FROM THE BUBBLES TO THE GALACTIC HALO INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM. WE PROPOSE TO PERFORM JOINT ANALYSIS WITH UP-TO-DATE FERMI-LAT DATA AND JANSKY VLA DATA TO STUDY THE MAGNETIC FIELD ALONG THE EDGE OF THE FERMI BUBBLES.

doc.ContractDescription: MICRO-X IS A SOUNDING ROCKET PAYLOAD THAT COMBINES AN X-RAY MICROCALORIMETER WITH AN IMAGING MIRROR TO OFFER THE FIRST BREAKTHROUGH SCIENCE FROM HIGH SPECTRAL RESOLUTION OBSERVATIONS OF EXTENDED X-RAY SOURCES. THIS PAYLOAD HAS BEEN IN DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT FOR THE LAST TWO YEARS AND IS ON SCHEDULE AND ON BUDGET FOR A FIRST LAUNCH IN JANUARY 2011. THE GOAL OF THIS THREE-YEAR PROJECT IS TO CARRY OUT THE FIRST TWO FLIGHTS OF THIS EXCITING PAYLOAD. THE PROJECT DETAILED IN THE PROPOSAL WILL: - PERFORM HIGH-VALUE SCIENCE AHEAD OF THE EXPECTED LAUNCH OF THE ASTRO-H JAPANESE MISSION AND WELL AHEAD OF THE INTERNATIONAL X-RAY OBSERVATORY (IXO). - PERFORM THE FIRST FLIGHT OF A TRANSITION-EDGE-SENSOR MICROCALORIMETER, DEMONSTRATING AND ADVANCING THE TECHNOLOGY READINESS LEVEL OF STATE-OF-THE-ART DETECTOR AND READ-OUT TECHNOLOGIES WHICH ARE PRIME CANDIDATES FOR IXO. - ADVANCE THE READINESS OF FUTURE NASA LEADERS THROUGH THE TRAINING OF UNDERGRADUATES, GRADUATE STUDENTS, AND POST-DOCTORAL AND JUNIOR RESEARCHERS. THE SCIENTIFIC PAYLOAD CONSISTS OF A TRANSITION EDGE SENSOR (TES) MICROCALORIMETER ARRAY AT THE FOCUS OF A FLIGHT-PROVEN CONICAL IMAGING MIRROR. MICRO-X CAPITALIZES ON TWO DECADES OF NASA INVESTMENT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF MICROCALORIMETERS LEADING UP TO THE CURRENT EFFORT TO DEVELOP A TES MICROCALORIMETER ARRAY FOR THE INTERNATIONAL X-RAY OBSERVATORY. MICRO-X WILL OFFER A UNIQUE COMBINATION OF BANDPASS, COLLECTING AREA, AND SPECTRAL AND ANGULAR RESOLUTION. THE SPECTRAL RESOLUTION ACROSS THE 0.3-2.5 KEV BAND WILL BE 4 EV FWHM (WITH A 2 EV GOAL). THE ANGULAR RESOLUTION WILL BE 4' FOR THE FIRST FLIGHT, AND 30'' FOR THE NEXT TWO FLIGHTS. THE EFFECTIVE AREA, 300 CM^2 AT 1 KEV, IS SUFFICIENT TO PROVIDE OBSERVATIONS OF UNPRECEDENTED QUALITY OF SEVERAL COSMIC X-RAY SOURCES, EVEN IN A BRIEF SOUNDING ROCKET EXPOSURE OF 300 S. OUR SCIENTIFIC PROGRAM FOR THIS PROPOSAL WILL FOCUS ON EXTENDED SOURCES, FOR WHICH HIGH SPECTRAL RESOLUTION OBSERVATIONS WERE HITHERTO IMPOSSIBLE OR EXTREMELY LIMITED. FOR SUPERNOVA REMNANTS (SNRS) THE MICRO-X OBJECTIVES ARE TO PROBE THE VELOCITY STRUCTURE OF THE EJECTA FOR INSIGHTS INTO THE EXPLOSION DYNAMICS, AND TO APPLY PLASMA LINE DIAGNOSTICS TO CONSTRAIN THE THERMODYNAMIC AND IONIZATION STATE OF THE PLASMA AND THE ELEMENT ABUNDANCES. FOR CLUSTERS OF GALAXIES, MICRO-X CAN UNIQUELY STUDY TURBULENCE, VELOCITIES, AND THE TEMPERATURE PHASES OF THE PLASMA. FOR OUR INITIAL FLIGHT IN JANUARY 18, 2011, WE WILL OBSERVE AN EJECTA REGION IN THE PUPPIS A SNR. M87, THE CENTER OF THE VIRGO CLUSTER, IS THE TARGET OF THE SECOND FLIGHT IN 2012. BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THESE FLIGHTS, AND SUBJECT TO A SUBSEQUENT PEER REVIEW, A THIRD FLIGHT TO OBSERVE THE CAS A SNR IS PLANNED FOR EARLY 2014. ADVANCING AND DEMONSTRATING THE READINESS LEVEL OF TES TECHNOLOGY IS ANOTHER VERY IMPORTANT CONTRIBUTION OF THIS PAYLOAD TO THE FIELD. WE PROPOSE TO CONTINUE ADVANCING THE TECHNOLOGY READINESS OF TES MICROCALORIMETERS WHILE ENHANCING THE SCIENCE CAPABILITY OF THE PAYLOAD WITH EACH OBSERVATION BY IMPLEMENTING A SERIES OF IMPROVEMENTS FOR EACH FLIGHT. WITH MICRO-X, WE HAVE DESIGNED A VERSATILE PAYLOAD CAPABLE OF PROVIDING THE X-RAY COMMUNITY WITH ACCESS TO HIGH-RESOLUTION SPECTROSCOPY FOR THE NEXT DECADE. THE DATA OBTAINED WILL MAKE A SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTION TO ASTROPHYSICS IN HELPING TO ADDRESS IMPORTANT SCIENCE QUESTIONS ABOUT THE FORMATION OF STRUCTURE ON BOTH THE STELLAR AND GALACTIC SCALES AHEAD OF THE ASTRO-H MISSION AND YEARS BEFORE IXO. THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO AID IN THE UNDERSTANDING AND DEVELOPMENT OF FUTURE FLIGHT-QUALIFIED MICROCALORIMETER SYSTEMS FOR LARGER ORBITING MISSIONS. FINALLY, IT WILL CONTINUE TO ATTRACT TALENTED YOUNG SCIENTISTS TO X-RAY ASTROPHYSICS AND THUS SERVE AS A DIRECT PIPELINE OF EXPERIMENTAL EXPERTISE FOR THE INTERNATIONAL X-RAY OBSERVATORY AND OTHER NASA MISSIONS.
